instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Picture, backlight or chime.
threads.message:
Fan spins up high if TP not connected, normal when connected.

Seem to be missing <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL>

<CHIP>U8300</CHIP> is getting <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> but L8304 measures 0v.

Will try with an external screen once my adapter gets returned, but it doesn't chime so I'm not expecting much.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Picture, backlight or chime.
threads.message: CPU Vcore present? USB mouse lighting up?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Picture, backlight or chime.
threads.message:
CPU VCore is present at 1.05.

Mouse never lights up.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Picture, backlight or chime.
threads.message: Well that is not a good start. Any history on this board?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Picture, backlight or chime.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 20577"]Well that is not a good start. Any history on this board? [/QUOTE]

Customer said it works but has no picture, it was dropped off while I was out so didn't get to speak with her.

Board is clean, I can only see a little discolour around <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Picture, backlight or chime.
threads.message:
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]  any suggestions on this board?
Trying to get this one fixed, I've had a run of trashed boards this last week.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Picture, backlight or chime.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3900</CHIP> gets so hot it burnt my finger!

Edit.

<CHIP>U3900</CHIP> seems to control the camera. I am thinking of cutting power off from it and seeing if that improves the rest of the board.

Can someone suggest the best way of removing power. Thinking of removing L3901, but maybe L3903/4 too.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Picture, backlight or chime.
threads.message:
Ended up just removing <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>. Board boots fine.

Mark solved, customer said they can survive without camera.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Picture, backlight or chime.
threads.message:
half of my customers have tape over it anyway. It puts a smile on my face when I see that - it means I can remove <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> without having to "sell" them anything ;)

I'm glad to hear it worked.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Picture, backlight or chime.
threads.message:
I'm getting a few of taped up cameras too lately.
Always makes me wonder what they get up to in front of the laptop that they feel needs to be hidden. :D

I think you did a video on that once.
